text: Protosolpuga carbonaria is an extinct species of solifuges, the only one of the genus Protosolpuga and the family Protosolpugidae. This Carboniferous camel spider was discovered in the Mazon Creek Formation in Illinois. An illustration of Protosolpuga == References == Category:Solifugae Category:Carboniferous arthropods Category:Carboniferous animals of North America Category:Fossils of the United States Category:Paleontology in Illinois Category:Fossil taxa described in 1913
title: Protosolpuga
